stories.title: How to revoke smart contract token/wallet permissions

stories.text:
The Google Chrome product blog just published an article about their 10 favorite Chrome extensions of 2021:

https://blog.google/products/chrome/our-favorite-chrome-extensions-2021/

This got me wondering if Google has ever recommended a privacy extension for Chrome.
stories.title: Ask HN: Has Google ever recommended a privacy extension for Chrome?
The new American dream: getting paid to do nothing?
Carmaker’s $23B Plan to Keep You Paying Long After You’ve Bought Your Car
Apple Music’s voice plan likely to launch with iOS 15.2

stories.text:
Our small business has about ~50 employees, all with varying degrees of technological understanding (blue collar to white collar). I'm looking for an app that allows us to report expenses

- company credit card

- personal credit card for reimbursement.

- mileage reimbursement

Any suggestions/recommendations?
stories.title: Ask HN: Best expense reporting app for small business (~50 employees)?

stories.text:
I have been thinking a lot about pro-active dependency management. I would like to have a tool or a way to gather latest release versions of various tools and then ideally get alerted if a new version gets released.

For example Gradle is at 7.3.1, if 7.3.2 becomes available I would like to know about it. Doing it for a single tool is simple, but having to track latest Git version, NPM, Gradle and all the other tools I work with doesn't scale very well.

Is there an existing solution to this problem?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you Track new Versions of Dependencies?
